summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and a victim's civil attorney, Robert Glassman. The emails discuss scheduling an interview with a victim (referred to as 'her'), the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, and the issuance of subpoenas to schools for student records to corroborate a timeline. The chain also references a civil lawsuit filed by the victim against Epstein and Donald Trump.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing a victim in the Epstein investigation. He is coordinating with SDNY prosecutors regarding an interview with his client and the handling of subpoenas to schools.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: An attorney from the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office copied on emails discussing the investigation, scheduling, and subpoenas related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.context: An attorney from the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office involved in the investigation, mentioned in discussions about subpoenaing schools and scheduling interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the sex trafficking investigation. The emails discuss investigating his conduct and corroborating timelines related to a victim.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as a defendant in a civil lawsuit filed by the victim, who claims Epstein introduced her to Trump when she was 14.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: U.S. District Judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: U.S. Magistrate Judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim.

persons.name: Moskowitz
persons.context: An individual who had already reached out to Robert Glassman, mentioned in passing in the email chain.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose specific conduct the SDNY prosecutors wanted to discuss with the victim during an upcoming interview.

connections.description: Attorney for a victim coordinating with SDNY prosecutors regarding the criminal investigation and witness interviews.
Attorney for a victim communicating with SDNY prosecutors about investigative steps like subpoenas and scheduling.
Both are prosecutors with the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office working on the Epstein investigation.
Glassman is the legal representative for a victim in both the SDNY criminal investigation and a related civil lawsuit.
The SDNY investigation is focused on corroborating the victim's allegations of abuse by Epstein.
Prosecutors intend to discuss the conduct of both Epstein and Maxwell with the victim.
The victim filed a civil lawsuit naming Trump as a defendant, alleging Epstein introduced them.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of a victim against Jeffrey Epstein and Donald Trump. The suit alleges Epstein introduced the victim to Trump when she was 14.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with Victim
events.description: SDNY prosecutors (Werksman, Boyle) schedule an in-person interview with a victim and her attorney, Robert Glassman, in Los Angeles.

events.title: Subpoenas Issued to Schools
events.description: SDNY prosecutors inform Glassman they are subpoenaing schools for student records to corroborate aspects of the victim's timeline, being careful not to mention Epstein in the subpoenas.

events.title: Previous Meeting with Victim
events.description: A prior meeting occurred between SDNY prosecutors, the victim, and her attorney Robert Glassman.

locations: 11111 Santa Monica Boulevard, Suite 700, Los Angeles, CA 90025 (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP office)
New York, NY (Southern District of New York jurisdiction)
keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and coordinating interviews with a victim as of February 2020.
The victim had filed a civil lawsuit against both Jeffrey Epstein and Donald Trump, alleging Epstein introduced her to Trump when she was 14.

Prosecutors were subpoenaing schools for student records to corroborate the victim's timeline, taking care not to mention Epstein in the subpoenas to avoid alerting the schools to the nature of the investigation.
The email chain shows careful coordination between criminal prosecutors (SDNY) and a victim's civil attorney (Robert Glassman) regarding witness access and investigative steps.
The assigned judges for the civil lawsuit were U.S. District Judge John Koeltl and U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses.
